file_content.text: [This cache contains weapons and technology the Flesh Raiders use to raid and hunt the Twi'leks.]
Once they have all this, the Twi'leks can defend themselves....
[Take it for the villagers]
Wish I could see the Flesh Raiders' faces when this stuff blows up on them....
[Sabotage it to kill enemies]
T7 = glad to see Jedi! // T7 = captured by Flesh Raiders + needs rescuing
Don't worry, little guy. I'll get you out of here.
Consider yourself rescued.
Jedi = T7's hero
Captured?
I didn't come here for you, droid.
That's your problem, not mine.
Serving Jedi Order = T7's primary programming
T7 = Jedi reconnaissance droid // Mission parameters = scout wilderness + identify hazards
T7's restraining bolt = faulty + malfunctioning // T7's sensors = unable to detect Flesh Raider ambush
Good thing the Flesh Raiders don't eat droids.
I'm glad you're in one piece.
What made the Flesh Raiders bring you back here?
Why did they capture you?
Flesh Raiders = interested in technology // T7 = advanced astromech droid + very valuable
Right, the old "restraining bolt" excuse. Admit it--you're just incompetent.
You useless bucket of bolts.
T7 = well maintained + always loyal // Restraining bolt = unnecessary
T7 = simulated deactivation + used spy camera // T7 = recorded Flesh Raider allies
Teach our soldiers how to use these weapons. Train them on the Twi'lek invaders.
When will we strike against the Jedi?
Patience, Callef. The Jedi will fall when our army reaches full strength.
T7 recording = useful // Jedi = take T7 to safety + remove restraining bolt
Never understood the need for restraining bolts, anyway....
Of course I'll remove it.
I expect you to obey my orders, understand?
Don't make me regret this.
Restraining bolt removed = increased T7 scanning range // Flesh Raiders = in big trouble now
You can come with me, but I'm not removing anything.
The restraining bolt stays.
T7 prediction = fifty percent survival chance until next maintenance
T7 = ready to roll!
I need to think this through.
[Leave it alone]
[You step back from the tech cache, leaving it undisturbed.]
